meta_description: Discover the Vincent Price Art Museum, a hub for art, culture, and education at East LA College. Explore exhibitions, events, and our permanent collections.
hours_text:
# 

## **“A jewel of a museum, tucked away in East LA, showing NEXT LEVEL artists with roots in LA.  
There isn’t aNOTHER ONE quite like it.” **  
Catherine B., Sierra Madre

## ON VIEW

### 

### OFELIA ESPARZA: A RETROSPECTIVE

**EXHIBITION DATES:** 10/18/2025 – 04/18/2026 

Widely recognized as one of California’s most revered folk artists with a cultural impact spanning more than seven decades, Esparza helped bring the cherished traditions of Mexican altar-making and Día de los Muertos into the American mainstream, beginning in the 1970s, through her work with community arts center Self Help Graphics & Art in Boyle Heights. 

[VIEW DETAILS](https://vpam.org/exhibitions/ofelia-esparza-a-retrospective/)

### ACT ON IT! ARTISTS, COMMUNITY, AND THE BROCKMAN GALLERY IN LOS ANGELES

**EXHIBITION DATES:** 09/27/2025 – 01/24/2026 

Act on It! showcases dozens of works from the Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA) collection, capturing the aesthetic, political, and social statements encountered by Brockman Gallery visitors and underscoring the reach and lasting significance of the Davis brothers’ project.

[VIEW DETAILS](https://vpam.org/exhibitions/act-on-it-artists-community-and-the-brockman-gallery-in-los-angeles/)

### DEL ALMA: LATINA PORTRAITS FROM THE VINCENT PRICE ART MUSEUM @ The Music Center

**EXHIBITION DATES:** 04/13/2024 – 05/31/2026 

Del Alma: Latina Portraits from the Vincent Price Art Museum presents an intergenerational group of portraits by Los Angeles-base...
accessibility_text:
# Accessibility

VPAM strives for excellence in accessibility and guest engagement. We actively seek ways to improve the museum’s physical and virtual environs and communications to serve a broad spectrum of audience needs with the aim to provide a safe and engaging environment for all. 

* * *

If you have any needs not addressed below, we encourage you to call 310-443-7000 or email [_info@vpam.org_ f](info@vpam.org)or assistance. 

# Arriving at VPAM

**Street Entry** Street-facing entries to the museum are located on Collegian Avenue. This entry includes an accessible ramp. 

**Accessible Parking** Accessible parking spaces are located in ELAC’s Parking Structure 4 on Level 1. 

**Drop-Offs** Visitors may be dropped off and picked up at the curb outside the entrance on Collegian Avenue where there is an accessible ramp to the front door of the museum.   

## GETTING AROUND THE MUSEUM

**Wheelchairs** All public areas of the museum are wheelchair accessible. The museum does not provide wheelchairs for visitor use.

**Service Dogs** Service dogs are allowed. However, pets or emotional support animals are unfortunately not allowed in the museum.

**Elevators** Access to all floors of the museum can be reached by elevator. 

**Seating and resting areas** Benches are accessible on all floors of the museum. 

**ASL Services** For campus events, employees, students or community members must request ASL services at least three days before the event to allow time to arrange service...
